stepTitle:
A sample of $$3.00$$ mol of helium (He), which behaves as an ideal gas, is initially at a temperature of $$300$$ K and occupies a volume of $$40.0$$ L. The gas undergoes an isobaric (constant pressure) expansion to a final volume of $$80.0$$ L.
Given:
Universal gas constant R $$=$$ $$8.314$$ J mol⁻¹ K⁻¹
The molar heat capacity at constant pressure for helium, $$c_P$$ $$=$$ $$20.8$$ J K⁻¹ mol⁻¹

Calculate the temperature of the gas in the final state, T_2​.
stepBody: Give your answer in Kelvin (K) to the nearest integer.
